q: With the dismissal of one rumor came the start of another, as many supporters now believe the Columbus, Ind., born and raised congressman may seek a shot at the governor's mansion. In the months ahead, as we attend to our duties in Congress, we will also be traveling across the state to listen and learn about how Hoosiers think we might best contribute in the years ahead, Mike Pence said. Instead, Eric Schmidt repeated Google's previously disclosed explanation that the management reshuffle is about clarifying and tightening lines of authority among the troika that has jointly run Google for a decade. This has nothing to do with competitors, Eric Schmidt said. "I publicly said the next 10 years will be as successful as the past 10. We're going to run this way for a while. Sergio Marchionne told dealers and industry executives he believes it is important that Chrysler maintain its "American nature." That American nature needs to be preserved for its ultimate success, he said to applause. "We can open up the world to Chrysler, we can do a number of things, but I can not turn it into an Italian car company."

The 51-year-old congressman's future has been the subject of speculation since he resigned the No. 3 GOP House leadership slot after easily winning in November for a sixth term from his eastern Indiana district. I am convinced he is now going to run for governor, said Mike McDaniel , a former state Republican chairman. Mike McDaniel said Mike Pence might be waiting to announce a decision on a gubernatorial bid out of respect for Mitch Daniels , a potential GOP presidential aspirant who has said he

, RV... Omaha is a good place for children, a national advocacy group says. America's Promise Alliance, an advocacy group founded by Ret. Colin Powell , has named Omaha among its 2010 100 Best Communities for Young People. Boys Town also was recognized. The awards celebrate extraordinary community-wide efforts to improve the well-being of youths and reduce the rate of high school dropouts. The Omaha award notes, in particular

the legendary heavyweight champion Mohammed Ali and Secretary of State Colin Powell . Tony first showed an interest in becoming a broadcast journalist at the tender age of 5. His mother remembers him watching the news and saying This is Tony Smith with the 6 o'clock news. Tony was born in Chicago and is a graduate of Barry University in Miami. Tony spends his free time watching movies, enjoying the great outdoors and swimming. He lives in the Aksarben Village area.
